body_html:
Is there a recommended way to handle this right now, strictly within tensorflow? Or is the answer to wait for #5463 to get completed.

I.e., to use tf.train.shuffle_batch to get inputs--e.g., sentences--of varying lengths, and then pad them (as if dynamic_pad=True was passed)? I'm unclear if the dynamic padding operation can be elegantly implemented from within TF.
body_text:

I.e., to use tf.train.shuffle_batch to get inputs--e.g., sentences--of varying lengths, and then pad them (as if dynamic_pad=True was passed)?  I'm unclear if the dynamic padding operation can be elegantly implemented from within TF.
body:
Is there a recommended way to handle this right now, strictly within tensorflow?  Or is the answer to wait for https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/5463 to get completed.

I.e., to use tf.train.shuffle_batch to get inputs--e.g., sentences--of varying lengths, and then pad them (as if dynamic_pad=True was passed)?  I'm unclear if the dynamic padding operation can be elegantly implemented from within TF.
